title: Workers Can Refuse the J&J Shot For Religious Reasons
itunes:title: Workers Can Refuse the J&J Shot For Religious Reasons
description:
Bloomberg Law Reporter Robert Iafolla discusses whether workers can refuse to take Johnson & Johnson’s Covid-19 vaccine on religious grounds because of its use of cloned fetal cells to make the vaccine. Environmental law professor, Pat Parenteau of the Vermont Law School, discusses the 12 Republican states suing the Biden administration over its climate agenda in a case centering on the ‘social cost’ of greenhouse gases. June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
